div.p: Containing, Divine POEMS, On Several Choice SUBJECTS.
div.q: PSALM XLV.I. My Heart is Inditing a Good Matter.
div.p: Written by Mrs. AMEY HAYWARD, Of Limmington.
LONDON, Printed by Benj. Harris, in great Eastcheap, for the Author. 1699.

div.head: A PANEGYRICK In PRAISE of the AUTHOR

lg.head: [I.]
lg.l: WELL Done, Poetick Soul,
Let Envy Rage,
And (big with Critick's Poyson) fret it's fill,
To see thy Lines, drawn with a loftier Quill,
Than ever came
From feign'd Parnassus's Hill,
Which does Presage,
Thy Heav'n-inrolled Name,
Shall be Transmitted down to everlasting Fame!

lg.head: [II.]
lg.l: Indeed, thy Time's well spent,
In teaching all
T'improve their Talents in an Age tha •• grown
So Paganiz'd, as Man's asham'd to own
His Lord and King,
When as he plainly sees,
The World's vast Ball,
And all that is therein,
[Except's Ingrateful Self] acknowledges the thing.

lg.head: [III.]
lg.l: A Christ, [with some] is now
Of no Effect!
Aloof such Moralists, with all their Train,
Who'll all be Damn'd, unless they're Born again!
Can Men, by Works,
Think ever to Obtain
(At least, expect)
Salvation for their Spirits,
When they invalid both their Saviour's Blood and Merits?

lg.head: [IV.]
lg.l: If Carpers do Despise
This Work, because
One of the fairer Sex it was that Pen'd it,
Let 'em Consult their Alcherons to mend it;
For, sure what's in't,
Compels me to Defend it:
But if some Flaws,
Those Criticks chance to 'spye,
I am the Person who'll Protect her Poetry.
